item.title: Setting up kubernetes to use cert-manager to use LetsEncrypt with domains hosted on Amazon Route 53
item.description:
Now that my Talos cluster is up, and I have PVCs working with NFS the next thing to do is get cert-manager working with LetsEncrypt. The tutorials I’ve seen all use CloudFlare, but I have my lab domain on Route 53 so this post will cover that instead.

Pre-requisites

  • A domain hosted on Amazon Route 53 that you have administrative rights on.
  • A working kubernetes cluster. I’m using Talos for mine, but regular kubernetes or k3s clusters will work too.
  • kubectl & helm - if you don’t want to brew install them, install instructions are at helm.sh and kubectl.
